FuncDef: The display multicast forwarding-table command displays the multicast forwarding table.
CLIs: display multicast [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance ] forwarding-table [ slot <slot-id> | <group-address> [ mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask> } ] | <source-address> [ mask { <source-mask-length> | <source-mask> } ] | [ verbose ] | incoming-interface { { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } | register | clone } | outgoing-interface { include | exclude | match } { { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } | register | none | clone-pseudo } | statistics ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VPN instance. vpn-instance-name specifies the name of the VPN instance.
The name is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates all the instances.
-

Specifies the slot number of an interface board. The parameter is used to describe only distributed devices. If slot-number is not specified, information about all multicast forwarding entries on the main control board is displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the multicast group address, used to specify a multicast group.
The address is in dotted decimal notation and ranges from 224.0.1.0 to 239.255.255.255.

Indicates the mask of a multicast address or source address.
-

Specifies the mask length of the multicast group address.
The value is a decimal integer that ranges from 4 to 32.

Specifies the mask of the multicast group address.
The mask is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of the multicast source address.
The mask is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of the multicast source address.
The value is a decimal integer that ranges from 0 to 32.

Specifies the mask of the multicast source address.
The mask is in dotted decimal notation.

Detailed information.
-

Indicates the incoming interface of a multicast forwarding entry.
-

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Indicates the register interface of a multicast forwarding entry.
-

Indicates the outgoing interface of a multicast forwarding entry.
-

Indicates the (S, G) entry list that contains the specified downstream interface.
-

Indicates the (S, G) entry list that does not contain the specified downstream interface.
-

Indicates the (S, G) entry list that matches the specified interface and the (S, G) entries have only one specified interface.
-

Indicates that the downstream interface list is null.
-

Indicates the statistics of the multicast forwarding table.
-

Cloned outbound interface.
-

Cloned incoming interface.
-

Examples: Multicast Forwarding Table of VPN-Instance: public_net
Matched 0 packets(0 bytes), Wrong If 0 packets
Multicast Forwarding Table of VPN-Instance: public_net
Matched 0 packets(0 bytes), Wrong If 0 packets
Multicast Forwarding Table of VPN-Instance: public_net
Total number of replicated flows is 3
<HUAWEI> display multicast vpn-instance ng forwarding-table slot 1
Multicast Forwarding Table of VPN-Instance: ng
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display multicast forwarding-table command is used to view the multicast forwarding table on the main control board or an interface board. If no slot number is specified in this command, the multicast forwarding table on the main control board is displayed.
Configuration Impact
Running the display multicast forwarding-table command consumes resources on the main control board or interface board.
